Address: 300 S State St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Retro-style counter-serve chain known for made-to-order toasted sandwiches, salads & baked goods.

summary.snippet: "Really cool location, friendly service, and my family loved the sandwiches."
"Never too crowded, fast service, and a great place to eat/study upstairs"
"Prices were a little high, but the food is tasty."

most_relevant.description: Great restaurant! Love potbelly, at least this location. The prices are very reasonable and portions are good. One meal and a milkshake had me full for hours (in a good way). I would recommend every sandwich, very flavorful! The milkshakes were also delicious and well worth the money. Oreo flavor is perfect.

The food is high-quality and fresh, there are many options thanks to customizability, the service is quick and friendly, location is great and convenient. This is the perfect go-to sandwich shop. All the sandwiches are great, just make sure to add the hot peppers.
The Mediterranean is my personal favorite.

Great place and they are always polite! They always crack jokes and it’s amazing! I saw this one lady tho her name is Rebekah or something that she was being extremely rude to the customers and she frequently goes to harass everyone. It’s ridiculous she does not even work there she works at CVS. Rude woman. But the staff at Potbelly’s is amazing and super nice.

I work right by this place and every time I go in they are rude food is good but the manager at this one tall slender woman I have had issues before I even apologized and it takes the bigger person to apologize and she shrugged her shoulders at me so next time I won't apologize actually I'm never going back at this location I work in customer service and it sucks there I order online and pick up only and I was waiting for my food I set a date and time and I paid for a large drink and I got it while I waited and they yelled out sis you pay for that? I have my uniform on from cvs where I work at and I'm not gonna walk up and just take but I paid for mine and I was on my lunch break and was kinda in a rush to get back and eat with only 30 min to eat we are neighbors tho and they treat me poorly and it's crazy to me but nope this spot for me is a no go I'm gonna tell all my friends too about it

Placed a large lunch order for my office, food was OK, sandwiches lacked flavor and very dry.  Delivery was difficult, driver called and stated they did not speak any english. Once I was able to locate the delivery, the driver couldn’t confirm my order, couldn’t communicate directions for signing. Driver  arrived on a MoPed with my order smushed in between his legs and on the back. Will not be ordering for again!

I have recently started a new job in Ann Arbor, I have never tried Potbelly so I decided to try it for lunch. My last transaction there was Saturday June 15th, which is still processing in my bank account. Today at 1:06 PM I got a charge from a Potbelly in Chicago, IL. I called the Ann Arbor location before I knew it came from Chicago and spoke with their manager Matt, who said there was no history of that transaction at their location.  I finally called my bank and they did confirm the location was indeed in Chicago and did confirm that my card was indeed compromised at the Ann Arbor location considering it is the only Potbelly I have ever visited (which shows in my recent history). Please be careful using your card at their machines or using it there in general because I have only visited a couple times and now my credit card information was stolen by someone.

Really want to like this place but my last two powerhouse salads had rotten cucumbers, and since it was to go I didn't know until I was back at work. They had to have seen them while adding the chicken, right? The tomatoes also tasted off even though they looked ok.

Hi, I just ordered a chicken salad sandwich today with extra toppings of lettuce, light mayo, and seasoning. I had my order delivered and it was unopened when I got it, so it was not tampered with after being bought. Upon opening the sandwich right out of the bag, there is ONLY lettuce and mayo, no chicken salad. I paid for much more than what I got. It is disgusting, a lettuce and mayo sandwich. Is there a way I can get a partial refund or something?

I have had past good experiences with potbellys so naturally I'm very disappointed.

I can not find another way to contact you about my wrong order so I'm doing it here. I dont think I've ever asked for a refund or pointed out a wrong order in my life because I know food service staff are so busy and stressed, but a lettuce sandwich is a bit worse than just giving me the wrong food item.

The shake was very good, and even the bread was good. I have had the chicken sandwich before so I knew what good thing I was missing. Thank you
